result.execSummary:
The defendant John Christian Serrano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: *Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
*Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

*NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Complete a parenting class.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.

timeConds.notes: * This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.

Defendant John Christian Serrano in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment or attend school.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Christian Serrano in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Christian Serrano in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/07/15 in Branch 40.   Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant John Christian Serrano in court.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape#15-138
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 40 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/20/15 @ 1:30 pm
